intro: Krynitzkia lithocarya, commonly known as the Lithuanian rock cress, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and features small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are basal, oblanceolate, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Krynitzkia lithocarya is adapted to withstand drought and temperature extremes, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
